titleStmt.title: A liuing remembrance of Master Robert Rogers, marchant aduenturer & leatherseller of London deceased, who declared the fruites of his faith, by his most christian & charitable workes And left this life at his house in Bassings-hall the 22. of September. And was buried in Christ-church on Thursday the 1. of October. 1601.

publicationStmt.publisher: For M. Allde, and are to be solde at her shop vnder Saint Mildreds Church in the Poultry,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "When bad men dye, the memorie remaines".
Followed by a list of Rogers's legatees.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
